lead_paragraph: To the Editor: ''Acceptable Nursing Home Care'' (editorial, Aug. 7) suggests that Congress ''wait a year'' before setting staff ratios for nursing homes. California is not waiting to set staff ratios. As of April 1, California law required 3.2 hours of direct care per patient per 24-hour day.
abstract: Letter from nursing home administrator Christopher Cherney notes that new California law sets nursing home staffing standards (Aug 7 editorial)

headline.main: Toward Better Care for the Old
